Author: Kofi Annan

Quote: Outside of a dog, a book is a man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quote: I cannot think of any need in childhood as strong as the need for a father's protection.
Author: Sigmund Freud

Quote: Patience is not simply the ability to wait - it's how we behave while we're waiting.
Author: Joyce Meyer

Quote: The bond that links your true family is not one of blood, but of respect and joy in each other's life.
Author: Richard Bach

Quote: Mother's love is peace. It need not be acquired, it need not be deserved.
Author: Erich Fromm

Quote: Prayer does not change God, but it changes him who prays.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: In every walk with nature one receives far more than he seeks.
Author: John Muir

Quote: I don't make jokes. I just watch the government and report the facts.
Author: Will Rogers

Quote: The tree of liberty must be refreshed from time to time with the blood of patriots and tyrants.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quote: Personality is everything in art and poetry.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quote: Every great dream begins with a dreamer. Always remember, you have within you the strength, the patience, and the passion to reach for the stars to change the world.
Author: Harriet Tubman

Quote: Success is no accident. It is hard work, perseverance, learning, studying, sacrifice and most of all, love of what you are doing or learning to do.
Author: Pele

Quote: If you are not too long, I will wait here for you all my life.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: Tears come from the heart and not from the brain.
Author: Leonardo da Vinci

Quote: Luck is believing you're lucky.
Author: Tennessee Williams

Quote: Only two things are infinite, the universe and human stupidity, and I'm not sure about the former.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: Because of your smile, you make life more beautiful.
Author: Thich Nhat Hanh

Quote: Unlike a drop of water which loses its identity when it joins the ocean, man does not lose his being in the society in which he lives. Man's life is independent. He is born not for the development of the society alone, but for the development of his self.
Author: B. R. Ambedkar

Quote: Throw your dreams into space like a kite, and you do not know what it will bring back, a new life, a new friend, a new love, a new country.
Author: Anais Nin

Quote: Football is football and talent is talent. But the mindset of your team makes all the difference.
Author: Robert Griffin III

Quote: Hope smiles from the threshold of the year to come, whispering, 'It will be happier.'
Author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

Quote: Yesterday is not ours to recover, but tomorrow is ours to win or lose.
Author: Lyndon B. Johnson

Quote: I believe forgiveness is the best form of love in any relationship. It takes a strong person to say they're sorry and an even stronger person to forgive.
Author: Yolanda Hadid

Quote: Let us never forget that government is ourselves and not an alien power over us. The ultimate rulers of our democracy are not a President and senators and congressmen and government officials, but the voters of this country.
Author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

Quote: Time spent with cats is never wasted.
Author: Sigmund Freud

Quote: We never know the love of a parent till we become parents ourselves.
Author: Henry Ward Beecher

Quote: The two most powerful warriors are patience and time.
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Quote: Most good relationships are built on mutual trust and respect.
Author: Mona Sutphen

Quote: For every minute you remain angry, you give up sixty seconds of peace of mind.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: There should be no discrimination against languages people speak, skin color, or religion.
Author: Malala Yousafzai

Quote: Nature always wears the colors of the spirit.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: I must study politics and war that my sons may have liberty to study mathematics and philosophy.
Author: John Adams

Quote: Fighting corruption is not just good governance. It's self-defense. It's patriotism.
Author: Joe Biden

Quote: As human beings, we are the only organisms that create for the sheer stupid pleasure of doing so. Whether it's laying out a garden, composing a new tune on the piano, writing a bit of poetry, manipulating a digital photo, redecorating a room, or inventing a new chili recipe - we are happiest when we are creating.
Author: Gary Hamel

Quote: Death is not the greatest loss in life. The greatest loss is what dies inside us while we live.
Author: Norman Cousins

Quote: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: Your positive action combined with positive thinking results in success.
Author: Shiv Khera

Quote: I love you - I am at rest with you - I have come home.
Author: Dorothy L. Sayers

Quote: The good times of today, are the sad thoughts of tomorrow.
Author: Bob Marley

Quote: I try to be grateful for the abundance of the blessings that I have, for the journey that I'm on and to relish each day as a gift.
Author: James McGreevey

Quote: Success is a science; if you have the conditions, you get the result.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: Peace is the beauty of life. It is sunshine. It is the smile of a child, the love of a mother, the joy of a father, the togetherness of a family. It is the advancement of man, the victory of a just cause, the triumph of truth.
Author: Menachem Begin

Quote: Individual commitment to a group effort - that is what makes a team work, a company work, a society work, a civilization work.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: There is always space for improvement, no matter how long you've been in the business.
Author: Oscar De La Hoya

Quote: Winners never quit and quitters never win.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: New Year's Day. A fresh start. A new chapter in life waiting to be written. New questions to be asked, embraced, and loved. Answers to be discovered and then lived in this transformative year of delight and self-discovery. Today carve out a quiet interlude for yourself in which to dream, pen in hand. Only dreams give birth to change.
Author: Sarah Ban Breathnach

Quote: Each day, I come in with a positive attitude, trying to get better.
Author: Stefon Diggs

Quote: If you love someone, set them free. If they come back they're yours; if they don't they never were.
Author: Richard Bach

Quote: Passion is energy. Feel the power that comes from focusing on what excites you.
Author: Oprah Winfrey

Quote: Until one has loved an animal a part of one's soul remains unawakened.
Author: Anatole France

Quote: At the end of the day, the most overwhelming key to a child's success is the positive involvement of parents.
Author: Jane D. Hull

Quote: Great works are performed not by strength but by perseverance.
Author: Samuel Johnson

Quote: One of the most sincere forms of respect is actually listening to what another has to say.
Author: Bryant H. McGill

Quote: To survive in peace and harmony, united and strong, we must have one people, one nation, one flag.
Author: Pauline Hanson

Quote: To be a Christian without prayer is no more possible than to be alive without breathing.
Author: Martin Luther

Quote: Every flower is a soul blossoming in nature.
Author: Gerard De Nerval

Quote: In politics, nothing happens by accident. If it happens, you can bet it was planned that way.
Author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

Quote: When you open your heart to patriotism, there is no room for prejudice. The Bible tells us, 'How good and pleasant it is when God's people live together in unity.'
Author: Donald Trump

Quote: Poetry is not a turning loose of emotion, but an escape from emotion; it is not the expression of personality, but an escape from personality. But, of course, only those who have personality and emotions know what it means to want to escape from these things.
Author: T. S. Eliot

Quote: It's sad when someone you know becomes someone you knew.
Author: Henry Rollins

Quote: A good teacher can inspire hope, ignite the imagination, and instill a love of learning.
Author: Brad Henry

Quote: The real man smiles in trouble, gathers strength from distress, and grows brave by reflection.
Author: Thomas Paine

Quote: Success is the result of perfection, hard work, learning from failure, loyalty, and persistence.
Author: Colin Powell

Quote: All that we see or seem is but a dream within a dream.
Author: Edgar Allan Poe

Quote: I am closest to my mother, as she is my rock, my pillar of strength, and my world. Not only has she stood by me through all times - happy, sad, and otherwise - but there have even been moments when I had completely lost hope, and her immense belief in me had lifted me up.
Author: Amruta Khanvilkar

Quote: Christ beside me, Christ before me, Christ behind me, Christ within me, Christ beneath me, Christ above me.
Author: Saint Patrick

Quote: Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: The real man smiles in trouble, gathers strength from distress, and grows brave by reflection.
Author: Thomas Paine

Quote: Early childhood education is the key to the betterment of society.
Author: Maria Montessori

Quote: The Universe is under no obligation to make sense to you.
Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

Quote: I've missed more than 9000 shots in my career. I've lost almost 300 games. 26 times, I've been trusted to take the game winning shot and missed. I've failed over and over and over again in my life. And that is why I succeed.
Author: Michael Jordan

Quote: What I like to drink most is wine that belongs to others.
Author: Diogenes

Quote: Work hard for what you want because it won't come to you without a fight. You have to be strong and courageous and know that you can do anything you put your mind to. If somebody puts you down or criticizes you, just keep on believing in yourself and turn it into something positive.
Author: Leah LaBelle

Quote: How people treat you is their karma; how you react is yours.
Author: Wayne Dyer

Quote: Words are singularly the most powerful force available to humanity. We can choose to use this force constructively with words of encouragement, or destructively using words of despair. Words have energy and power with the ability to help, to heal, to hinder, to hurt, to harm, to humiliate and to humble.
Author: Yehuda Berg

Quote: Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea.
Author: Robert A. Heinlein

Quote: Don't worry that children never listen to you; worry that they are always watching you.
Author: Robert Fulghum

Quote: I believe that a trusting attitude and a patient attitude go hand in hand. You see, when you let go and learn to trust God, it releases joy in your life. And when you trust God, you're able to be more patient. Patience is not just about waiting for something... it's about how you wait, or your attitude while waiting.
Author: Joyce Meyer

Quote: When you practice gratefulness, there is a sense of respect toward others.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quote: Peace is not absence of conflict, it is the ability to handle conflict by peaceful means.
Author: Ronald Reagan

Quote: Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: I have seen many storms in my life. Most storms have caught me by surprise, so I had to learn very quickly to look further and understand that I am not capable of controlling the weather, to exercise the art of patience and to respect the fury of nature.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: Bad politicians are sent to Washington by good people who don't vote.
Author: William E. Simon

Quote: Our flag honors those who have fought to protect it, and is a reminder of the sacrifice of our nation's founders and heroes. As the ultimate icon of America's storied history, the Stars and Stripes represents the very best of this nation.
Author: Joe Barton

Quote: The poetry of the earth is never dead.
Author: John Keats

Quote: The science of today is the technology of tomorrow.
Author: Edward Teller

Quote: The purpose of human life is to serve, and to show compassion and the will to help others.
Author: Albert Schweitzer

Quote: Let us remember: One book, one pen, one child, and one teacher can change the world.
Author: Malala Yousafzai

Quote: You gain strength, courage, and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face. You are able to say to yourself, 'I lived through this horror. I can take the next thing that comes along.'
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quote: Put your heart, mind, and soul into even your smallest acts. This is the secret of success.
Author: Swami Sivananda

Quote: Morning without you is a dwindled dawn.
Author: Emily Dickinson

Quote: Let my soul smile through my heart and my heart smile through my eyes, that I may scatter rich smiles in sad hearts.
Author: Paramahansa Yogananda

Quote: I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else.
Author: C. S. Lewis

Quote: The art and science of asking questions is the source of all knowledge.
Author: Thomas Berger

Quote: Beauty is power; a smile is its sword.
Author: John Ray

Quote: There is pleasure in the pathless woods, there is rapture in the lonely shore, there is society where none intrudes, by the deep sea, and music in its roar; I love not Man the less, but Nature more.
Author: Lord Byron

Quote: I believe in Liberty for all men: the space to stretch their arms and their souls, the right to breathe and the right to vote, the freedom to choose their friends, enjoy the sunshine, and ride on the railroads, uncursed by color; thinking, dreaming, working as they will in a kingdom of beauty and love.
Author: W. E. B. Du Bois

Quote: Sports do not build character. They reveal it.
Author: Heywood Broun

Quote: Every time you tear a leaf off a calendar, you present a new place for new ideas and progress.
Author: Charles Kettering

Quote: A positive attitude can really make dreams come true - it did for me.
Author: David Bailey

Quote: Never above you. Never below you. Always beside you.
Author: Walter Winchell

Quote: If the sight of the blue skies fills you with joy, if a blade of grass springing up in the fields has power to move you, if the simple things of nature have a message that you understand, rejoice, for your soul is alive.
Author: Eleonora Duse

Quote: No one appreciates the very special genius of your conversation as the dog does.
Author: Christopher Morley

Quote: Having a baby is a life-changer. It gives you a whole other perspective on why you wake up every day.
Author: Taylor Hanson

Quote: Patience, persistence and perspiration make an unbeatable combination for success.
Author: Napoleon Hill

Quote: A child who is allowed to be disrespectful to his parents will not have true respect for anyone.
Author: Billy Graham

Quote: Did I offer peace today? Did I bring a smile to someone's face? Did I say words of healing? Did I let go of my anger and resentment? Did I forgive? Did I love? These are the real questions. I must trust that the little bit of love that I sow now will bear many fruits, here in this world and the life to come.
Author: Henri Nouwen

Quote: All these walls that keep us from loving each other as one family or one race - racism, religion, where we grew up, whatever, class, socioeconomic - what makes us be so selfish and prideful, what keeps us from wanting to help the next man, what makes us be so focused on a personal legacy as opposed to the entire legacy of a race.
Author: Kanye West

Quote: Study nature, love nature, stay close to nature. It will never fail you.
Author: Frank Lloyd Wright

Quote: The ballot is stronger than the bullet.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: Guard against the impostures of pretended patriotism.
Author: George Washington

Quote: Poetry is not only dream and vision; it is the skeleton architecture of our lives. It lays the foundations for a future of change, a bridge across our fears of what has never been before.
Author: Audre Lorde

Quote: Technology is a useful servant but a dangerous master.
Author: Christian Lous Lange

Quote: It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are.
Author: e. e. cummings

Quote: There is no pain so great as the memory of joy in present grief.
Author: Aeschylus

Quote: Teaching is a very noble profession that shapes the character, caliber, and future of an individual. If the people remember me as a good teacher, that will be the biggest honour for me.
Author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

Quote: Strength and growth come only through continuous effort and struggle.
Author: Napoleon Hill

Quote: Some people dream of success, while other people get up every morning and make it happen.
Author: Wayne Huizenga

Quote: The connection to place, to the land, the wind, the sun, stars, the moon... it sounds romantic, but it's true - the visceral experience of motion, of moving through time on some amazing machine - a few cars touch on it, but not too many compared to motorcycles. I always felt that any motorcycle journey was special.
Author: Antoine Predock

Quote: Never make a decision when you are upset, sad, jealous or in love.
Author: Mario Teguh

Quote: Love is never defeated, and I could add, the history of Ireland proves it.
Author: Pope John Paul II

Quote: Science is a way of thinking much more than it is a body of knowledge.
Author: Carl Sagan

Quote: Smile, it is the key that fits the lock of everybody's heart.
Author: Anthony J. D'Angelo

Quote: We won't have a society if we destroy the environment.
Author: Margaret Mead

Quote: For the wise man looks into space and he knows there is no limited dimensions.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: Many men go fishing all of their lives without knowing that it is not fish they are after.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: Celebrate what you want to see more of.
Author: Tom Peters

Quote: Adopting the right attitude can convert a negative stress into a positive one.
Author: Hans Selye

Quote: We are afraid to care too much, for fear that the other person does not care at all.
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quote: If you realized how powerful your thoughts are, you would never think a negative thought.
Author: Peace Pilgrim

Quote: There's a saying. If you want someone to love you forever, buy a dog, feed it and keep it around.
Author: Dick Dale

Quote: To be a good father and mother requires that the parents defer many of their own needs and desires in favor of the needs of their children. As a consequence of this sacrifice, conscientious parents develop a nobility of character and learn to put into practice the selfless truths taught by the Savior Himself.
Author: James E. Faust

Quote: Have patience. All things are difficult before they become easy.
Author: Saadi

Quote: Football is like life - it requires perseverance, self-denial, hard work, sacrifice, dedication and respect for authority.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: War is peace. Freedom is slavery. Ignorance is strength.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: My religion is very simple. My religion is kindness.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quote: In nature, light creates the color. In the picture, color creates the light.
Author: Hans Hofmann

Quote: We need to reject any politics that targets people because of race or religion. This isn't a matter of political correctness. It's a matter of understanding what makes us strong. The world respects us not just for our arsenal; it respects us for our diversity and our openness and the way we respect every faith.
Author: Barack Obama

Quote: A soldier will fight long and hard for a bit of colored ribbon.
Author: Napoleon Bonaparte

Quote: The world is full of poetry. The air is living with its spirit; and the waves dance to the music of its melodies, and sparkle in its brightness.
Author: James Gates Percival

Quote: Animals have come to mean so much in our lives. We live in a fragmented and disconnected culture. Politics are ugly, religion is struggling, technology is stressful, and the economy is unfortunate. What's one thing that we have in our lives that we can depend on? A dog or a cat loving us unconditionally, every day, very faithfully.
Author: Jon Katz

Quote: Good habits formed at youth make all the difference.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Autumn wins you best by this its mute appeal to sympathy for its decay.
Author: Robert Browning

Quote: Mama was my greatest teacher, a teacher of compassion, love and fearlessness. If love is sweet as a flower, then my mother is that sweet flower of love.
Author: Stevie Wonder

Quote: When you rise in the morning, give thanks for the light, for your life, for your strength. Give thanks for your food and for the joy of living. If you see no reason to give thanks, the fault lies in yourself.
Author: Tecumseh

Quote: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
Author: Winston Churchill

Quote: A tramp, a gentleman, a poet, a dreamer, a lonely fellow, always hopeful of romance and adventure.
Author: Charlie Chaplin

Quote: The word 'happy' would lose its meaning if it were not balanced by sadness.
Author: Carl Jung

Quote: Cherish your human connections: your relationships with friends and family.
Author: Joseph Brodsky

Quote: Bad times have a scientific value. These are occasions a good learner would not miss.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Nothing you wear is more important than your smile.
Author: Connie Stevens

Quote: Where justice is denied, where poverty is enforced, where ignorance prevails, and where any one class is made to feel that society is an organized conspiracy to oppress, rob and degrade them, neither persons nor property will be safe.
Author: Frederick Douglass

Quote: The moon is a friend for the lonesome to talk to.
Author: Carl Sandburg

Quote: Finding good players is easy. Getting them to play as a team is another story.
Author: Casey Stengel

Quote: All of us every single year, we're a different person. I don't think we're the same person all our lives.
Author: Steven Spielberg

Quote: Work hard, stay positive, and get up early. It's the best part of the day.
Author: George Allen, Sr.

Quote: A healthy friendship is one where you share your true feelings without fearing the end of the relationship. It's also one where you sometimes have to let things that bug you slide. The tough moments will make you wiser about yourself and each other. They will also make you stronger and closer as friends.
Author: Rachel Simmons

Quote: Every day we have plenty of opportunities to get angry, stressed or offended. But what you're doing when you indulge these negative emotions is giving something outside yourself power over your happiness. You can choose to not let little things upset you.
Author: Joel Osteen

Quote: My little dog - a heartbeat at my feet.
Author: Edith Wharton

Quote: Every word, facial expression, gesture, or action on the part of a parent gives the child some message about self-worth. It is sad that so many parents don't realize what messages they are sending.
Author: Virginia Satir

Quote: Never cut a tree down in the wintertime. Never make a negative decision in the low time. Never make your most important decisions when you are in your worst moods. Wait. Be patient. The storm will pass. The spring will come.
Author: Robert H. Schuller

Quote: Our parents deserve our honor and respect for giving us life itself. Beyond this they almost always made countless sacrifices as they cared for and nurtured us through our infancy and childhood, provided us with the necessities of life, and nursed us through physical illnesses and the emotional stresses of growing up.
Author: Ezra Taft Benson

Quote: Observe good faith and justice toward all nations. Cultivate peace and harmony with all.
Author: George Washington

Quote: We need to reject any politics that targets people because of race or religion. This isn't a matter of political correctness. It's a matter of understanding what makes us strong. The world respects us not just for our arsenal; it respects us for our diversity and our openness and the way we respect every faith.
Author: Barack Obama

Quote: Nature's beauty is a gift that cultivates appreciation and gratitude.
Author: Louie Schwartzberg

Quote: Politics have no relation to morals.
Author: Niccolo Machiavelli

Quote: The patriot volunteer, fighting for country and his rights, makes the most reliable soldier on earth.
Author: Stonewall Jackson

Quote: From the beginnings of literature, poets and writers have based their narratives on crossing borders, on wandering, on exile, on encounters beyond the familiar. The stranger is an archetype in epic poetry, in novels. The tension between alienation and assimilation has always been a basic theme.
Author: Jhumpa Lahiri

Quote: Technology can be our best friend, and technology can also be the biggest party pooper of our lives. It interrupts our own story, interrupts our ability to have a thought or a daydream, to imagine something wonderful, because we're too busy bridging the walk from the cafeteria back to the office on the cell phone.
Author: Steven Spielberg

Quote: The youth need to be enabled to become job generators from job seekers.
Author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

Quote: Tears are the silent language of grief.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: If a country is to be corruption free and become a nation of beautiful minds, I strongly feel there are three key societal members who can make a difference. They are the father, the mother and the teacher.
Author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

Quote: Unity is strength... when there is teamwork and collaboration, wonderful things can be achieved.
Author: Mattie Stepanek

Quote: Self-belief and hard work will always earn you success.
Author: Virat Kohli

Quote: The thing is that love gives us a ringside seat on somebody else's flaws, so of course you're gonna spot some things that kinda need to be mentioned. But often the romantic view is to say, 'If you loved me, you wouldn't criticise me.' Actually, true love is often about trying to teach someone how to be the best version of themselves.
Author: Alain de Botton

Quote: It's sad when someone you know becomes someone you knew.
Author: Henry Rollins

Quote: Our hearts were drunk with a beauty Our eyes could never see.
Author: George William Russell

Quote: Democracy is the art and science of running the circus from the monkey cage.
Author: H. L. Mencken

Quote: Let us always meet each other with smile, for the smile is the beginning of love.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quote: Where do the evils like corruption arise from? It comes from the never-ending greed. The fight for corruption-free ethical society will have to be fought against this greed and replace it with 'what can I give' spirit.
Author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

Quote: If your ego starts out, 'I am important, I am big, I am special,' you're in for some disappointments when you look around at what we've discovered about the universe. No, you're not big. No, you're not. You're small in time and in space. And you have this frail vessel called the human body that's limited on Earth.
Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

Quote: Sports teaches you character, it teaches you to play by the rules, it teaches you to know what it feels like to win and lose-it teaches you about life.
Author: Billie Jean King

Quote: And now we welcome the new year. Full of things that have never been.
Author: Rainer Maria Rilke

Quote: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see a shadow.
Author: Helen Keller

Quote: We don't develop courage by being happy every day. We develop it by surviving difficult times and challenging adversity.
Author: Barbara De Angelis

Quote: There is an amazing power getting to know your inner self and learning how to use it and not fight with the world. If you know what makes you happy, your personality, interests and capabilities, just use them, and everything else flows beautifully.
Author: Juhi Chawla

Quote: Before you get a dog, you can't quite imagine what living with one might be like; afterward, you can't imagine living any other way.
Author: Caroline Knapp

Quote: Let parents bequeath to their children not riches, but the spirit of reverence.
Author: Plato

Quote: Patience is bitter, but its fruit is sweet.
Author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

Quote: Respect for ourselves guides our morals, respect for others guides our manners.
Author: Laurence Sterne

Quote: An eye for an eye only ends up making the whole world blind.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Work out your own salvation. Do not depend on others.
Author: Buddha

Quote: Green is the prime color of the world, and that from which its loveliness arises.
Author: Pedro Calderon de la Barca

Quote: In our age there is no such thing as 'keeping out of politics.' All issues are political issues, and politics itself is a mass of lies, evasions, folly, hatred and schizophrenia.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: This nation will remain the land of the free only so long as it is the home of the brave.
Author: Elmer Davis

Quote: What can a pencil do for all of us? Amazing things. It can write transcendent poetry, uplifting music, or life-changing equations; it can sketch the future, give life to untold beauty, and communicate the full-force of our love and aspirations.
Author: Adam Braun

Quote: Humanity is acquiring all the right technology for all the wrong reasons.
Author: R. Buckminster Fuller

Quote: Youth is not a time of life; it is a state of mind; it is not a matter of rosy cheeks, red lips and supple knees; it is a matter of the will, quality of the imagination, a vigor of the emotions; it is the freshness of the deep springs of life.
Author: Samuel Ullman

Quote: Grief is the price we pay for love.
Author: Queen Elizabeth II

Quote: Education is the key to success in life, and teachers make a lasting impact in the lives of their students.
Author: Solomon Ortiz

Quote: Calm mind brings inner strength and self-confidence, so that's very important for good health.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quote: There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, and learning from failure.
Author: Colin Powell

Quote: Kiss me and you will see how important I am.
Author: Sylvia Plath

Quote: Grief is never something you get over. You don't wake up one morning and say, 'I've conquered that; now I'm moving on.' It's something that walks beside you every day. And if you can learn how to manage it and honour the person that you miss, you can take something that is incredibly sad and have some form of positivity.
Author: Terri Irwin

Quote: We have always found the Irish a bit odd. They refuse to be English.
Author: Winston Churchill

Quote: Science means constantly walking a tightrope between blind faith and curiosity; between expertise and creativity; between bias and openness; between experience and epiphany; between ambition and passion; and between arrogance and conviction - in short, between an old today and a new tomorrow.
Author: Heinrich Rohrer

Quote: Your smile will give you a positive countenance that will make people feel comfortable around you.
Author: Les Brown

Quote: Voting is how we participate in a civic society - be it for president, be it for a municipal election. It's the way we teach our children - in school elections - how to be citizens, and the importance of their voice.
Author: Loretta Lynch

Quote: You cannot look up at the night sky on the Planet Earth and not wonder what it's like to be up there amongst the stars. And I always look up at the moon and see it as the single most romantic place within the cosmos.
Author: Tom Hanks

Quote: I couldn't find the sports car of my dreams, so I built it myself.
Author: Ferdinand Porsche

Quote: Come, gentlemen, I hope we shall drink down all unkindness.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: I believe if you keep your faith, you keep your trust, you keep the right attitude, if you're grateful, you'll see God open up new doors.
Author: Joel Osteen

Quote: I think for any relationship to be successful, there needs to be loving communication, appreciation, and understanding.
Author: Miranda Kerr

Quote: Words have no power to impress the mind without the exquisite horror of their reality.
Author: Edgar Allan Poe

Author: Barack Obama

Author: George Santayana

Author: Patrick Henry

Author: Rainer Maria Rilke

Author: John Keats

Author: William Butler Yeats

Author: Wernher von Braun

Quote: Peace begins with a smile.
Author: Mother Teresa

If we desire a society without discrimination, then we must not discriminate against anyone in the process of building this society. If we desire a society that is democratic, then democracy must become a means as well as an end.
Author: Bayard Rustin

Quote: Nothing exists except atoms and empty space; everything else is opinion.
Author: Democritus

Quote: At a dinner party one should eat wisely but not too well, and talk well but not too wisely.
Author: W. Somerset Maugham

Quote: A strong, positive self-image is the best possible preparation for success.
Author: Joyce Brothers

Author: James Herriot

Author: Polly Berrien Berends

We might plead for prosperity, and we receive enlarged perspective and increased patience, or we petition for growth and are blessed with the gift of grace. He may bestow upon us conviction and confidence as we strive to achieve worthy goals.
Author: David A. Bednar

Author: Orison Swett Marden

Author: Anne Frank

Quote: Wherever men and women are persecuted because of their race, religion, or political views, that place must - at that moment - become the center of the universe.
Author: Elie Wiesel

Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: Vote for the man who promises least; he'll be the least disappointing.
Author: Bernard Baruch

Author: Malcolm X

Author: Maria Mitchell

Author: Dean Kamen

Author: Arnold H. Glasow

Author: Saint Augustine

Author: Maggie Gallagher

Author: Samuel Johnson

Author: Christopher Marlowe

Author: Edgar Allan Poe

Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Author: Albert Schweitzer

Author: Frank A. Clark

Quote: Be patient and understanding. Life is too short to be vengeful or malicious.
Author: Phillips Brooks

Author: Frank Abagnale

Author: Dalai Lama

Author: Marquis de Lafayette

Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Author: Edward Everett Hale

Author: Bryant H. McGill

Author: Benjamin Franklin

Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Author: Ronald Reagan

Author: Joshua Logan

Author: Mark Twain

Author: Sridevi

Author: Renee Olstead

Quote: Your sacred space is where you can find yourself again and again.

Author: Mark Twain

Quote: I like cups of tea and reading books and poetry and old people things.
